measured_by: single-item Likert statement: “I often make use of rules of thumb when I forage.”
justification: The paper states that one of the eight five-point-scale items given to respondents was: “Heuristics – I often make use of rules of thumb when I forage.”

measured_by: single-item Likert statement: “When I go mushroom foraging, I have a strong hunch of which mushrooms I expect to find.”
justification: Among the eight survey statements the first was labelled Hunch: “When I go mushroom foraging, I have a strong hunch of which mushrooms I expect to find.”

measured_by: single-item Likert statement: “With a quick glance of a given terrain, I know which mushrooms could grow in the area.”
justification: The article lists Glance as an item: “Glance – With a quick glance of a given terrain, I know which mushrooms could grow in the area.”

measured_by: single-item Likert statement: “I keep the knowledge of bountiful mushroom hunting patches (‘apaja’) to myself or my close ones.”
justification: The text describes the Apaja item: “Apaja – I keep the knowledge of bountiful mushroom hunting patches (‘apaja’) to myself or my close ones.”

measured_by: single-item Likert statement: “I consider myself an experienced mushroom forager.”
justification: One of the eight statements is Experience: “I consider myself an experienced mushroom forager.”

measured_by: single-item Likert statement: “I mainly forage in familiar terrain.”
justification: The survey item Familiar is reported as: “Familiar – I mainly forage in familiar terrain.”

measured_by: single-item Likert statement: “I would rather protect a forest where I forage than other forests which I visit.”
justification: The Protect item is described: “Protect – I would rather protect a forest where I forage than other forests which I visit.”

measured_by: single-item Likert statement: “If I search for a specific delicious or precious species of mushroom, I don’t pick other species.”
justification: The eighth statement is Delicious: “Delicious – If I search for a specific delicious or precious species of mushroom, I don't pick other species.”
Participants reported their years of foraging experience; the article notes a mean of 25 years and analyses ‘Experience_years’ in the correlation plot.
The methods section reports that respondents provided their age (mean 49.6 years), and the variable Age is included in the correlation plot.

measured_by: numeric self-report: “how many species of mushrooms they forage on their average trip.”
justification: Respondents were asked “how many species of mushrooms they forage on their average trip,” and the resulting variable ‘Species’ is analysed in Figure 4C.
